intro: Biscutella laevigata proles granitica, commonly known as the granitic biscutella, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky, alpine environments. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically features hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh, arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils, often found on granite outcrops and mountain slopes. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient species within its ecological niche.
